actionPlugin.description: Changes the outcome field of an application.
actionPlugin.name: Change Outcome

actionPlugin.description: Changes the Status of an application
actionPlugin.name: Change Status

actionPlugin.description: All it does is print a message to the console. That's it.
actionPlugin.name: Console Logger

actionPlugin.description: Adds a record to verification table
actionPlugin.name: Create Verification

actionPlugin.description: Checks all the uploaded files associated with an application, and deletes any that are not part of an application_response
actionPlugin.name: Clean up application files

actionPlugin.description: Generates a PDF document from a Carbone template
actionPlugin.name: Generate Document

actionPlugin.description: Generates review_assignment records for current application
actionPlugin.name: Generate Review Assignment Records

actionPlugin.description: Generates serial numbers or arbitrary text strings (e.g. for application name) using a specified pattern, and updates a database record if requested
actionPlugin.name: Generate Text String

actionPlugin.description: Grants permission to user/org, creates permission join from user/org to permission name. If org not provided, the permission will be granted to the user only.
actionPlugin.name: Grant Permissions

actionPlugin.description: Increments (or creates) the application Stage, if possible.
actionPlugin.name: Increment Stage

actionPlugin.description: Links a user to an organisation
actionPlugin.name: Add User to Organisation

actionPlugin.description: Inserts or updates a record in database, e.g. User, Org
actionPlugin.name: Modify Record

actionPlugin.description: Creates a notification and send an email
actionPlugin.name: Send Email

actionPlugin.description: Trims duplicated application or review responses if nothing has changed
actionPlugin.name: Trim duplicate reponses

actionPlugin.description: Update status of Review Assignment records when one is Assigned
actionPlugin.name: Update Review Assignment statuses

actionPlugin.description: Updates status of associated reviews when application re-submitted
actionPlugin.name: Update Review Statuses

actionPlugin.description: Updates review response records to be visible to Applicant based on recommendations of last level review
actionPlugin.name: Update Applicant's Review Visibility

template.name: Edit User Details
template.submissionMessage: Thanks for updating your details. You will need to log out and log back into the system for the changes to take effect.

template.name: User Registration
template.submissionMessage: Thanks. Please check your email to verify your registration.

children:
## This is the general registration for feature showcase
Hi, %1. You will need to provide:
- Proof of identity (Passport, Drivers license)
- Proof of your medical certification
- Drug ingredient list
- Product images
- Packging images

template.name: Company Registration
template.startMessage:
## You will need the following documents ready for upload:
- Proof of organisation name
- Proof of organisation address
- Organisation licence document
template.submissionMessage: Thank you! Your application has been submitted.

template.name: Join Company
template.startMessage:
## You will need the following documents ready for upload:
- PhotoID
template.submissionMessage: Thank you! Your application has been submitted.

children:
## Registration complete!

Thanks, %1.

Please log in to continue.

Hi, %1,

please confirm your user account registration by clicking (or copy-pasting) the following link:

%2%3

message.value:
Testing parallel actions -- This message is Asynchronous. 
Even though it is last in the Actions list, it'll probably appear first.

children:
### Congratulations, %1!

Your application to join organisation %2 has been APPROVED.

[Application Dashboard](%3)

Please find attached the ID file you uploaded (testing attachment handling)

templateStage.title: Approval

templateElement.helpText: This page contain examples of the **Search** element. It can make API queries in response to user input and display the results, which can be selected.

parameters.label: Search for users

children: query GetUsers($user: String!) { users(filter: { username: {includesInsensitive: $user } }) {nodes { username, firstName, lastName }}}

parameters.description: Start typing to search database for usernames

templateElement.title: Search Demo (users)

parameters.label: Search for countries

children: query countries($code: ID!) {country(code: $code) {name, capital, emoji, code}}

parameters.description: Type the two-character country code (must be CAPS sorry)

children: query GetEntitiesByName($search: String!) {entities (filter: { code: "" description: $search type: "[drug]" match: "contains"},offset: 0,first: 25) {data {        code,     description,        type,        uid  }, totalLength }}

templateElement.helpText: This one has no `displayFormat` prop, so it falls back to a generic "default" display

parameters.label: Search for an organisation

children: query GetOrgs($registration: String!) { organisations(filter: {registration: {startsWithInsensitive: $registration}}) { nodes { name registration } } }
